document.masterDocTitle: New synonyms, combinations and status in the Chinese species of the family Meloidae Gyllenhal, 1810 (Coleoptera: Tenebrionoidea) with additional faunistic records

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. China : Beijing , Gansu , Hebei , Inner Mongolia , Jiangsu , Jilin (new record), Liaoning , Ningxia , Qinghai (new record), Shaanxi , Shandong , Shanghai , Shanxi , Sichuan , Tianjin , Zhejiang .

Remarks. The type locality of
Epicauta xantusi
ab. unicolora Kaszab, 1952 is “Hweisin, Kansu ”.
Růžička et al . (2002)
indicated this locality was Hua Xian, and gave its longitude and latitude, ca. 33°46´ N 106°04´ E. How-ever, no county is named Hua in Gansu Province . We searched the longitude and latitude, and found this locality is placed in the Hui County (= Huxian, in Chinese) of Longnan City, Ganus, which has a similar pronunciation to “Hweinsin”. Therefore, we considered the correct name of the type locality as Hui County.

E. xantusi Kaszab, 1952
could be distinguished from
E. obscurocephala
by their red temples, according to its original description ( Kaszab 1952a ). Based on the examination of the type specimens of these two species, we confirm Kaszab’s point of view. However, after the study of more than 400 specimens (MHBU), we found that the red portion of temples varies greatly. Especially, in a few cases, the temples have only a very small brown spot, which are almost invisible. Meanwhile, as in the case of
E. sibirica ( Pallas, 1773 )
, we conclude that this feature is not useful to determine species in
Epicauta (
Liu et al . 2016
)
. In conclusion,
E. xantusi
is synonymized with
E. obscurocephala
.
